intro: Fagonia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered fagonia, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and succulent leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its structure and morphology reflect its adaptation to harsh, dry environments. Fagonia parviflora is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
